events.title: Virginia's Declaration of Rights Adopted
events.description: The Virginia Declaration of Rights was adopted, asserting inherent rights of men and serving as a model for the U.S. Bill of Rights.
events.significance: It influenced the formation of fundamental human rights and constitutional principles in the United States and worldwide.

events.title: Nelson Mandela Sentenced to Life Imprisonment
events.description: Nelson Mandela was sentenced to life imprisonment for sabotage and other charges during the Rivonia Trial in South Africa.
events.significance: Marked a pivotal moment in the struggle against apartheid, making Mandela a global symbol of resistance and justice.

events.title: Philippines Hold First Snap Presidential Elections
events.description: President Corazon Aquino called for and won the first snap presidential elections after the People Power Revolution.
events.significance: Helped restore democratic government in the Philippines after years of authoritarian rule.

events.title: Mother Teresa Awarded Nobel Peace Prize
events.description: Mother Teresa was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for her humanitarian work with the poor and sick.
events.significance: Highlighted global commitment to charity and compassion, inspiring humanitarian efforts worldwide.
